Henry Lafayette King (April 7, 1922 â€“ June 5, 1983) was an American football player who played four seasons in the All-America Football Conference. "Fay" King played college football at the University of Georgia. He was drafted by the Rams of the National Football League in the seventh round of the 1946 NFL draft.
